intro: Blakwellia padiflora, commonly known as the narrowleaf blakwellia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. Blakwellia padiflora is a shrub that can reach up to 1 meter in height and is known for its ecological importance to local wildlife.
